_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary

1.	Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies (Overview of Facility)
Chem Techs policy is to fully comply with all applicable environmental laws and regulations. This includes compliance with EPAs Chemical Accident Prevention Program rules (40 CFR Part 68). Chem Tech is an adhesive manufacturing facility that utilizes AB80 (propane/butane mixture) in aerosol products. The AB80 covered process at Chem Tech consists of the storage of AB80 in a 18,000-gal capacity horizontal pressure vessel (bulk tank) located on the rear of the facility property and is dispensed into five mobile cylinders (100-gal tanks) to be used in the aerosol production process. One 100-gal tank is the largest capacity Chem Tech has connected to the building/aerosol production line at a time.  
The Risk Management Plan along with other safety and environmental programs already in-place enables Chem Tech to prevent the occurrence of fires, explosions, and other types of catastrophic accidents associated with AB80 storage and transfer. The emergency response plan is designed to minimize AB80 releases and potential for explosion or fire through prompt mitigation actions and immediate notification to the local fire department and outside emergency responders. 

2.	General Prevention Program and Rules/Regulations
AB80 components (propane and butane) are flammable substances listed in the Part 68 rule. AB80 is stored in a quantity that exceeds its components threshold quantity of 10,000 pounds under both the EPA RMP rule and the OSHA Process Safety Management (PSM) standard. Thus, propellant storage and filling of aerosol product is subject to both rules and the requirement for having RMP and PSM programs. As such, the AB80 process at Chem Tech meets the criteria for a Program Level 3 process as specified in the RMP rules. 
The AB80 bulk tank was designed and constructed per industry standards for pressure vessels and following good engineering practices. The ini

tial PHA in 2018 and the most recent PHA conducted July 07, 2023 used What-If analysis technique and checklists were used to ensure thorough coverage of human factors and stationary source facility siting. Additionally, unique site-specific issues were evaluated to ensure that all potential hazards of the AB80 were thoroughly reviewed.
Written operating procedures for AB80 delivery, storage, handling, and transfer are in place. All persons working with AB80 equipment have been trained on operating procedures and understand the consequences of deviation from the procedures. An Inspection, Testing, and Preventative Maintenance Program (ITPM) was created and is maintained to ensure the integrity of the process equipment.

3.	Five Year Accident History
No accidents involving AB80 have occurred in the last five years. 

4.	Emergency Response Program
Chem Tech maintains a written emergency response plan that employees are regularly trained on. The plan is coordinated with the Elkhart County Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) and the Bristol Fire Department. The emergency response plan includes procedures for stopping/mitigating release of AB80, if deemed safe to do so, and immediate notification to outside emergency responders. The Compliance Coordinator at Chem Tech has been a member of the Elkhart County LEPC since October 2022 and is the current vice chair of the Elkhart County LEPC. Chem Tech has conducted tabletop and drill exercises for emergency evacuation internally and before the end of 2024 will conduct a tabletop exercise of Chem Techs emergency response plan with local emergency responders. 

5.	Planned Changes to Improve Safety
Chem Tech has addressed the recommendations from the initial PHA as well as the PHA conducted in 2023, with only one recommendation outstanding at the time of this submission. The final recommendation is set to be completed by the end of 2024. The final recommendation will upgrade the gas monitoring system currently installed o

n the process with the addition of a monitor. Chem Tech is committed to improving safety and has promptly addressed recommendations suggested by third-parties and will continue to do so in the future.
